reviews.review_msg: Redundant (3 hours to say what a better prof could more clearly articulate in 1); notes: paragraphs, often from the text; open-book midterms: good if don't mind paying $500 to reword the text; final exam: too open-ended, but gave extra time; helpful in office hrs. Overall, good for GPA, but complicates and makes tedious an otherwise simple course.
He is the worst prof I had at SFU. Can't believe he is still teaching!!!
it's an interesting course but the take home exams are not easy

If you study his notes and understand the textbook well, you will get an A in his class. Well organized lectures but boring sometimes. Overall, he is an enthusiastic teacher. Negatives: He doesn't know how to explain stuff in an easily understandable way, so you better figure it out from his helpful notes and the informative textbook.
